title: Battle of North Falador

While the name or title of this topic is not officially recognised in-game, the information contained on this page is still considered to be canon and is based on official sources.
Battle of North Falador
Date 163th year of 5th age
Place North of Falador
Outcome Stalemate
Combatants
White Knights Black knights
Commanders
Unknown Lord Daquarius
Strength
Even with opponent Even with opponent
Casualties
Unknown Unknown

Battle of North Falador was the battle in year 163 of 5th age between the Falador White Knights and the Kinshra.[1]

The battle was result of power revolution in Falador when King Vallance, then ruler of Asgarnia, became ill.[2] The White Knights used this opportunity to take over Falador and declared that the Black Knights wouldn't have any political power within Asgarnia. Lord Daquarius of the Kinshra immediately declared a state of war with Falador.[1]

The battle itself was fought north of Falador, between Falador and the Black knight fortress. Both sides were evenly matched, and ultimately both armies retreated to their respective fortresses in order to rebuild their strength and eventually crush the other side once and for all.[3]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 Display case 26, Old School RuneScape. "Year 163, 5th Age - The White Knights declared that the Black knights were no longer to have any political power within Asgarnia. Lord Daquarius of the Kinshra immediately responds by declaring his Black Knights as being at a state of war with Falador. The two sides engaged in a big battle to the north of Falador."
  2. ^ Display case 26, Old School RuneScape. "The old king of Asgarnia, King Vallance, falls very ill. The White Knights took advantage of this and began to take control of Falador and Asgarnia for themselves."
  3. ^ Display case 26, Old School RuneScape. "however, both sides were fairly evenly matched, and retreated to their fortresses to build up their forces and devise plans to crush the other, once and for all."
